sentences.english: Opportunity must be seized and acted upon in order to have value.
sentences.chinese: 必须抓住机会，见机行事才能创造佳绩。

sentences.english: I wish all the athletes the best of luck in their competitions.
sentences.chinese: 我预祝各参赛健儿在运动会能够取得佳绩。

sentences.english: Hysan aims to be a financially successful as well as a responsible business.
sentences.chinese: 希慎致力成为一间缔造财务佳绩及负责任的企业。

sentences.english: Wish our schoolmates great progress and more achievements.
sentences.chinese: 祝福我们的同学学习进步，再创佳绩。

sentences.english: Lovely deer, I wish you peace, let us work even better.
sentences.chinese: 可爱的鹿儿，祝你一生平安，让我们的工作再创佳绩。

sentences.english: Los Angeles is 9-1 since Bynum got hurt.
sentences.chinese: 拜纳姆伤后，湖人取得了9胜1负的佳绩。

sentences.english: We will create excellence hand in hand with you.
sentences.chinese: 福瑞人将与您携手并进，共创佳绩。

sentences.english: Besides, some frequenter to the list still occupied good positions.
sentences.chinese: 此外，经常出现在名单上的一些常客佳绩依然。

sentences.english: Rene acquired rich and practical experience in sales performance and sales team management.
sentences.chinese: 具有培训管理团队和创造佳绩的实战经验。

definition: worthy of pride/impressive/enviable/to show contempt for others

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
victory reports pour in (idiom); news of success in an endless stream
to take (after a struggle)/to wrest/to seize/to capture/to win (a trophy)
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
